messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, Sandrewmama
<sandrewmama@m...> wrote:
== He has always been
> extremely sensitive to my emotions. That is one of the things that
> moved me towards RU. He seemed to me, overeager to please and overly
> distraught when I was unhappy . Sometimes parents describe their
> kids as barometers for their moods. Well he was an extremely
> sensitive barometer and even the slightest dissatisfaction on my part
> created terrible emotional turmoil in him.==


You might enjoy reading _The Highly Sensitive Child_ by Elaine Aron.
Here's a website:
http://www.hsperson.com/

You might be interested in the Shine With Unschooling list for highly
sensitive and otherwise atypical children:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/shinewithunschooling/

I have found both of these resources extremely helpful in creating a
better unschooling environment and in having a better relationship
with my highly sensitive son.

Peace,
Amy
